result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnell Jammon Mayberry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnell Jammon Mayberry

records.addlTxt: of Representation by Attorney Ruby De Leon, filed.

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered Defendant to serve 60 DAYS the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 2 with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges for work.

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Court ordered Defendant to serve 30 DAYS the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Count 1 with credit for 0 DAYS time served. Huber privileges for work.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for NINE MONTHS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

-No violations that rise to the level of probable cause.

-Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 3:00pm on OCTOBER 11TH, 2022.  

-No use or possession of any firearms.

-Comply with any recommended treatment.

-No contact with LDC and no VIOLENT contact with BM.

-Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Darnell Jammon Mayberry in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Darnell Jammon Mayberry.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms.  Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant advised that if she is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing to proceed.

Defendant Darnell Jammon Mayberry in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Darnell Jammon Mayberry appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel was recently appointed and has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time to review. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LC or BM.

Defendant Darnell Jammon Mayberry in court.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  Defendant refused SPD services at this time. 
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6/14/2022 @2p
